description: Product JSON template for Nature's Elixir. This structure can be used to generate the CSV import file. All prices are in major currency units (EUR in euros) as required by MedusaJS 2.0. UK is included in the Europe region with EUR currency.

csv_mapping.category: Product Collection Id (Tea, Spartan Oils, Natural Sponges, etc.)
csv_mapping.variant_price_eur: Variant Price EUR (in euros, major units)

products.product_description: Apricot Tea is a deliciously fruity tea with the sweet juiciness of apricots. This tea offers a smooth, well-rounded flavour that is ideal for relaxing moments, whether enjoyed warm or as a refreshing iced tea. With each cup, you imbibe a blend of wellness and indulgence that has been revered for centuries. Benefits attributed to: Rich in potent antioxidants, can help fight free radicals and reduce oxidative stress, contributing to overall health and wellness.

Breakfast tea (contains caffeine) is the Rolls Royce of traditional teas. It is made from a blend of Assam, Ceylon, and Kenyan teas. It has a full taste and richness and has a far superior taste to those you might make with a teabag (which is tainted by plastic, glue and bleach). Benefits Attributed to: – Improves Heart Health – Reduces Cholesterol Levels – Promotes Mental Health – Helps to Detox.

Cacao tea (also known as chocolate tea) is a light and refreshing hot drink made from the husk of cacao beans. Cacao husks contain theobromine which some people find has a stimulant effect. Theobromine releases energy in a slower, more gentle way than caffeine, so you're less likely to have peaks and crashes. Also packed with antioxidants, flavonoids and magnesium. Benefits attributed to: -Mood enhancement -Heart health support -Improve blood flow -Reduces inflammation -Supports digestion, and provide minerals for focus and immunity

Calendula is a fresh, light and very drinkable cup of tea. It has an earthy flavour at its base. The other prominent flavours include a hint of spiciness and a pepper flavour. The most impressive health benefit of calendula is its ability to improve the appearance of the skin and as a treatment for candida. Benefits attributed to: – Skin and eye care – Oral health – Reduces inflammation – Eliminates cramps

Finalist in Blas na hEireann (Irish Food Awards) in 2021. Chamomile has gentle notes of apple, with a honey-like sweetness. It has a silky mouth feel with a clean, delicately floral taste, and even from the very first sip it feels wonderfully soothing. It has been praised over the years for its health benefits for digestion, skin complaints, relieving hay fever, easing anxiety and promoting peaceful sleep. Benefits attributed to: – Eases anxiety and promotes peaceful sleep – Diuretic, reduces weight caused by bloating – Full of antioxidants – Great for the skin (anti-ageing) and the hair

Dandelion has a similar taste to coffee, but it's less acidic and bitter. It has an earthy and herbaceous flavour. Dandelions are one of the rare super foods, and are packed full of vitamins, minerals and fibre. A great tea for getting rid of retained fluid (bloating), which is the hardest weight to lose. Benefits attributed to: – Reduces blood sugars – Supports the liver function – Boosts the immune system – Reduces cholesterol -Reduces weight by getting rid of retained fluid

Dittany has a strong, sharp and slightly bitter flavour, with a savoury nuance that reminds you of thyme. The scent is reminiscent of lemon and lavender. It is a powerful, restorative healing herb and is famed as a love potion in Greek mythology. Benefits attributed to: – Aids weight loss by stimulating the digestive system – Soothes the stomach and intestines – Anti-cellulite and anti-ageing – Good for colds and flu

Devil's Claw does not have an odour, but it does have a slightly bitter taste. It is used for "hardening of the arteries" (atherosclerosis), arthritis, gout, muscle pain (myalgia), back pain, fibromyalgia and tendonitis. Benefits attributed to: – Relief from arthritis – Relief from muscle pain – Relief from back pain – Relief from tendonitis -Apply to the skin for injuries and other skin conditions

Earl Grey tea is a classic black tea flavoured with bergamot oil, giving it a distinctive citrusy and floral aroma. This traditional blend offers a refined and elegant taste that has been enjoyed for centuries. The bergamot oil adds a bright, refreshing note to the robust black tea base, creating a well-balanced and sophisticated cup. Benefits attributed to: – Provides gentle energy boost from natural caffeine – Rich in antioxidants that support heart health – May help improve mental alertness and focus – Supports digestive health

The taste of Echinacea tea is often described as tongue-tingling. In fact, some regard this quality as evidence of the herb's effectiveness. Echinacea is commonly combined with mint or honey to make a more pleasant-tasting tea. It is most famous for boosting the immune system. Benefits attributed to: – Helps to fight colds and flu – Assists in controlling blood sugar – Helps manage anxiety – Lowers blood pressure

Fennel tea has a sweet, licorice-like flavour with a warm, aromatic quality. It is well-known for its digestive properties and has been used for centuries to support digestive health. The tea has a pleasant, slightly sweet taste that is both soothing and refreshing. Fennel is particularly valued for its ability to ease digestive discomfort and promote healthy digestion. Benefits attributed to: – Supports healthy digestion and reduces bloating – Helps relieve digestive discomfort and indigestion – May help reduce gas and stomach cramps – Contains antioxidants that support overall wellness

Green tea (contains caffeine) is typically green, yellow or light brown in colour, and its flavour profile can range from grass-like to vegetal and sweet. Our green tea is Royal Gunpowder and if you know your green teas you will know that it is excellent and hard to match taste and quality wise. The many health benefits of green tea make it a great drink to include in your diet. Benefits attributed to: – Can provide heart benefits – Helps to lower cholesterol – Assists in reducing inflammation – Aids focus and attention span

Hibiscus tea has a flavour profile that includes fruity, sweet, sour, and astringent notes. It is often compared to cranberries due to its tart yet sweet flavour. It is frequently brewed hot, but also makes an excellent iced tea. It's health benefits include its ability to reduce high blood pressure, high cholesterol, and inflammatory problems. Benefits attributed to: – Relief from headaches/ migraine – Relieves menstrual pain – Anti-depressant – Improves heart health and blood circulation

Jasmine tea has a delicate and subtle flavour profile with sweet floral notes, a fresh finish and a perfumed aroma. It is popular around the globe – and not only for its good taste! It has many health benefits that include improved cardiovascular health, stronger immune system, and prevention of diabetes. Benefits attributed to: – Boosts energy – Weight loss aid – Protects heart health – Relieves stress

Lavender tea has a unique and distinctive pleasant flavour with a floral aroma. It helps to relax the body, reducing muscle spasms, promoting healthy digestion, and aiding sleep. Benefits attributed to: – Relieves stress, improves mood and promotes restful sleep – Lowers skin irritation – Reduces inflammation – Prevents infections

Lemon balm tea is pleasantly mild, with subtle citrus notes. It has a pleasing lemon citric scent. It is traditionally used to support digestion and relieve nervous tension. Benefits attributed to: – Helps to relieve stress and reduce anxiety – Boosts cognitive function, mental clarity, concentration and relaxation – Eases insomnia and other sleep disorders – Assists in treating cold sores

Our first entrant in Blas na hEireann (2021) and our first Gold winner. It has a stunning taste and is beautifully calming. Lemon verbena tea has a bright, slightly sweet, herbaceous flavour with a hint of lemon. Its delicious taste makes it extremely popular amongst tea drinkers. It is also popularly taken to sooth the nerves and for weight loss. Benefits attributed to: – Aids in weight loss – Reduces joint pain – Boosts the immune system – Assists in reducing fever

Linden tea has a quite complex overall flavour. It is sweet with a pleasant delicate floral taste. The overall infusion is quite refreshing and has a very slight citrusy note to it. It has the ability to improve the immune system, detoxify the body and eliminate anxiety. Benefits attributed to: – Relieves anxiety and promotes relaxation – Prevents chronic diseases – Detoxifies the body – Reduces colds and flu

Liquorice tea has a sweet flavour and full-bodied richness, and is similar to that of anise and fennel. Benefits attributed to: – Improves heartburn – Controlling high cholesterol – Treating high potassium levels – Easing muscle cramps

Marrubium tea's flavour is often described as a middle ground between root beer and liquorice, having said that it does have a slightly bitter taste. It is extremely effective for lung and breathing problems including cough, whooping cough, asthma, tuberculosis and bronchitis. Benefits attributed to: – Protects and boosts the immune system – Extremely effective for lung and breathing problems – Excellent for coughs, whooping cough, asthma, tuberculosis and bronchitis. – Helps to manage diabetes

Our second entrant in Blas na hEireann / Irish Food Awards in 2022. We were delighted that it received the Bronze award. Mint tea has a slightly spicy peppermint flavour with a tiny bit of sweetness and a touch of minty flavour. The amazing health benefits of mint tea include improved digestion, weight loss, relief from nausea, depression, fatigue, and headache. It gives you a lovely clean and fresh smelling mouth, hence why it is used in toothpaste and to flavour sweets. Benefits attributed to: – Aids proper digestion and weight loss – Relief from nausea, depression, fatigue and headache – Treatment of asthma, memory loss and skin care problems (pimples) – Mouth and breath freshener

Nettle tea tastes like mild spinach without the strong iron flavour. It's green and grassy-tasting, not unlike other dark leafy plants, with a slight peppery taste. It helps the body to process and flush away toxins, and cleans the kidneys and bladder to prevent and soothe urinary tract infections. Benefits attributed to: – Anti-inflammatory and antihistamine properties – Assists with urinary tract infections – Gives a radiant look – Acts as a face cleanser, helps with scars, blemishes and eczema

Passion flower tea has a very mild taste with a slightly grassy, floral flavour to it and a little bit of an earthy note. It boasts many different benefits including the ability to reduce anxiety, treat sleep disorders, prevent depression, and stimulate the libido. It has tremendous calming effects. Benefits attributed to: – Reduces anxiety and nervousness – Great for a good night's sleep – Lowers blood pressure – Full of antioxidants

Rooibos tea is incredibly smooth and gentle with a natural sweetness and slightly nutty taste, when brewed for longer it is full-bodied and rich. Consumed in southern Africa for centuries, it has become a beloved drink around the world. It is known for its beneficial effects on those suffering from colic or diabetes, and it has the potential to alleviate headaches. Benefits attributed to: – Packed with antioxidants and polyphenols – Boosts heart health – Benefits people with type 2 diabetes – Aids bone health

Gold winner in Blas na hEireann / Irish Food Awards in 2025 in the Herbal and Fruit Tea Category. A delicious blend of chamomile, hibiscus, rose petals and rose hip. This gold winner offers powerful antioxidants, boosts immunity with high Vitamin C, reduces inflammation (especially joint pain), aids digestion, promotes relaxation (lowering stress/anxiety), and supports skin health by improving hydration and collagen. The floral aroma calms the mind, while compounds like polyphenols and flavonoids fight free radicals, helping protect against chronic diseases

Sage tea offers a delicate, sweet flavour that has earthy notes. It has a fragrant aroma and lends a warming feeling. It is full of antioxidants and anti-inflammatory compounds and helps to promote skin, oral, and brain health. Benefits attributed to: – Excellent for sore throats, coughs and colds – Strengthens the nervous system – Boosts the memory – Sharpens the senses

Greek mountain Tea or Shephard's Tea has a beautiful earthy taste with a slight floral scent. It is made from a native Greek mountain herb known as sideritis. It helps to boost the immune system, fight flu symptoms and stress-related ailments such as chest infections, a foggy head, digestive complaints, fatigue and anxiety. Benefits attributed to: – Full of flavonoids, powerful antioxidants with anti-inflammatory and immune system benefits – Rich in natural antioxidants – Anti-microbial/ kills or inhibits the growth of micro organisms – Anti-inflammatory

Awarded Gold at Blas na hEireann / Irish Food Awards in 2025. We received double gold in 2025 in the Herbal and Fruit Tea category. The Strawberry Kiwi tea was entered as a 'Cold Brew', simply make up a hot brew as normal (taste some if you want) and then let it go cold and serve it with ice and a mint leaf. Tasting sweet, tangy, and refreshing hot or iced. It is rich in antioxidants (Vitamin C, beta-carotene) for immunity and cell protection. Benefits attributed to: -Supports digestion -Boosts energy -Aids heart health (via lower cholesterol/blood pressure)

Senna tea can be slightly sweet, but it does also have bitter undertones. It can treat constipation, and may also help treat haemorrhoids that occur as a result of chronic constipation. It is also thought to have both anti-inflammatory and anti-parasitic properties. Benefits attributed to: – Helps with constipation and haemorrhoids – Aids with indigestion – Great for detoxing and weight loss – Helps with eczema and acne

Thyme tea has a very earthy rich flavour with subtle mint undertones. The aroma of thyme is very subtle and rather dry. Unlike many other herbs and spices, it isn't particularly aromatic. It helps to stimulate the memory, ease headaches and muscle tension, soothe coughs, relieve fevers, and fight colds and infections. Benefits attributed to: – Lowers blood pressure – Boosts your immune system – Excellent for skin problems like acne and eczema – Promotes cognitive health

Valerian tea has a woody taste. The plant grows well in moist, grassy areas so the tea has an earthy quality that is distinctive. The longer you brew valerian tea, the more intense the taste will be. Benefits of drinking the tea include improved sleep, decreased stress, menstrual symptom relief, and even a reduction of menopausal symptoms. Benefits attributed to: – Naturally aids sleep – Calms anxiety – Lowers blood pressure – Eases menstrual cramps

Gold winner in Blas na hEireann / Irish Food Awards in 2024 in the Herbal and Fruit Tea Category. A strong vibrant flavour of wild cherries. Smooth, aromatic, and naturally bright, it's a simple yet stunning infusion. It is packed with antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals that can help boost your immune system. Benefits attributed to: -assists respiratory health by soothing coughs (like bronchitis) and clearing mucus -acts as an expectorant and antitussive -it also supports digestion by calming upset stomachs -offers anti-inflammatory effects -has mild sedative properties, aiding relaxation
